section.title: Reconfiguring Ceph Services
section.para: Perform the following steps to reconfigure the Ceph services.

listitem.para: Configure the following parameters in the ~/openstack/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file.
Any additional configuration parameters for Ceph (beyond those listed in the ~/openstack/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file) can be specified in the same file under the extra: category:
listitem.screen: extra: osd: journal max write entries: 200
listitem.para: As shown above, configures the OSDs to write a maximum of 200 entries (journal max write entries: 200) to the journal at any one time.

important.para: The Ceph log parameter debug auth configures the verbosity of the authentication related logs, which by default is configured to a level of 1/5. Having debug auth logging verbosely is a security risk as the module will start logging the Ceph user secrets. These secrets will be available to users via the centralized logs, making the Ceph cluster vulnerable. Therefore, it is highly recommended not to have the debug auth logging verbosely.
